A score of 0 on the Raw Words per Minute, Mistakes, and Adjusted Words per Minute indicates that the test taker did not follow the passage closely enough for an accurate score to be determined.

tests.title: ACCPAC Pro Series
tests.description:
This ACCPAC Pro Series (which has been renamed Sage Pro ERP) test is designed to measure fundamental knowledge of ACCPAC accounting as well as the principles and terminology used by professional Accountants to manage day-to-day business operations. It will measure the test taker's ability to understand and use the ACCPAC system of menus, messages, and data entry screens associated with Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and General Ledger.

The Sage Group acquired ACCPAC International Inc. in 2004.

Assessments for Bookkeeping and Accounting Terminology - Basic are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Acrobat 7.0 Standard
tests.description:
The Adobe Acrobat 7.0 Standard assessment will determine a test taker's level of knowledge using Adobe Acrobat 7.0 Standard software for Windows. These questions ask about simple ways to create and share secure and reliable Adobe PDF documents. Test takers should know how to generate Adobe PDF files in a variety of ways, and understand how to take advantage of tools for sharing information, commenting on electronic files, and creating PDF documents.

An assessment for Adobe Acrobat 6.0 Standard is also available.

tests.title: Adobe Acrobat 8.0 Standard
tests.description: This Adobe Acrobat 8.0 Standard test is designed to assess the knowledge of test takers in using Adobe Acrobat. The topics covered include working with a PDF, toolbars, icon identification, security, and a general understanding of tools. It is appropriate to administer this assessment to test takers who have over one year of experience creating, formatting, and editing PDF files.

tests.title: Adobe Acrobat 9.0 Standard
tests.description: This Adobe Acrobat 9.0 Standard test is designed to assess the knowledge of test takers with the creation, editing, manipulation, distribution and printing of PDF documents. The topics covered include working with a PDF, toolbars, icon identification, security, and new features that have been introduced via version 9.0. It is appropriate to administer this assessment to test takers who have over one year of experience creating, formatting, and editing PDF files.

tests.title: Adobe Acrobat X
tests.description: This Adobe Acrobat X assessment is designed to assess a test taker's understanding of Adobe Acrobat concepts. The test taker will be challenged to utilize the exporting, editing, and multimedia features of Acrobat for producing documents. Topics covered by this test include document basics, working with a PDF, interactivity and media, portfolios, security and protection, and forms. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe Acrobat X.

tests.title: Adobe Acrobat XI
tests.description: This Adobe Acrobat XI test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of Acrobat as well as information related to Portable Document Format (PDF) files. Topics on this assessment include fundamentals, creating and converting PDFs, editing PDF content, PDF features, and working with Adobe Acrobat features. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe Acrobat XI.

tests.title: Adobe Dreamweaver - Creative Cloud
tests.description:
This Adobe Dreamweaver - Creative Cloud test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of Dreamweaver and the features specific to Creative Cloud. Other topics on this assessment include interactivity, managing sites, CSS, panels and views, managing files, and the interface. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe Dreamweaver - Creative Cloud.

Assessments for the Creative Cloud versions of Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign and Adobe Photoshop are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Flash CS3 Professional
tests.description:
This test is designed to measure the test taker's proficiency with the design, animation, and online publishing tools offered by the Adobe Flash CS3 Professional development package. While it includes questions regarding technical issues likely to be faced by any Flash professional today, it is not intended to measure one's knowledge of application development or more technical aspects of Flash/ActionScript software programming and debugging.

The test will focus on the basics of the Flash integrated design environment itself, the design and animation tools used to create original content within the Flash IDE, Third, the many tools for incorporating external assets such as image, audio and video files into Flash presentations, and the optimization techniques and best practices to ensure the test taker understands how best to use the tools provided.

Assessments for Adobe InDesign and Adobe Illustrator are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Flash Professional CS5
tests.description:
This Adobe Flash Professional CS5 test is designed to access a test taker's abilities and skills as an Adobe Flash developer. With this in mind, the assessment presents questions that focus on a variety of topics that include fundamentals, setting up a Flash scene, motion tweens, movie clips and video, ActionScript and interactivity, and animation basics. This assessment is appropriate for beginner and intermediate test takers with a year or more experience.

Additional Adobe CS5 assessments are available.

tests.title: Adobe Flex 3
tests.description:
This Adobe Flex 3 test focuses on the basic aspects needed by Flex programmers, plus the most essential parts of using the Flex Builder. Topics Include Flex fundamentals, events, XML data, application design, and displaying data. This assessment is appropriate to administer to those who have at least one year of experience with Adobe Flex 3.

A test for ActionScript 3 is also available.

tests.title: Adobe Illustrator - Creative Cloud
tests.description:
This Adobe Illustrator - Creative Cloud test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of Illustrator as well as features specific to Creative Cloud. Topics on this assessment include general terminology, objects, tools, panels, images, and workflow efficiency. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe Illustrator - Creative Cloud.

Assessments for the Creative Cloud versions of Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Dreamweaver and Adobe InDesign are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Illustrator CS
tests.description:
The test for Adobe Illustrator CS is a broad general test for people with about one year's experience through expert users. This test would be appropriate for business owners who are screening potential employees for their skill level, or for schools who need to know a student's proficiency for placement in classes. There are three types of questions: Graphics, Typography and Output.

Assessments for Adobe Photoshop CS and Adobe InDesign CD are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Illustrator CS2
tests.description:
Adobe Illustrator CS2 is a drawing, painting, and special-effects based illustration application that also enables users to create custom typography and produce basic page layouts. This test has been designed to gauge the candidate's functional knowledge of Adobe Illustrator CS2 and ability to utilize the broad set of tools and techniques available within the software. It covers subjects such as Drawing, type setting, color management, and placing art work.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator CS, Adobe Photoshop CS2, and Adobe PageMaker 7.0 are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Illustrator CS3
tests.description: This assessment is designed to be taken by designers with at least one year of extensive experience with Adobe Illustrator CS3. It evaluates knowledge and skill sets concerning color and transparency, creating and manipulating graphics, working with type, understanding and using special effects as well as 'Live Features', and finally printing and exporting. The new features of Illustrator CS3, such as Live Color, Isolation Mode, and aligning anchor points, are also tested throughout.

tests.title: Adobe Illustrator CS5
tests.description:
The Adobe Illustrator CS5 test is designed to assess an entry level test taker's ability to understand and use Illustrator. The assessment focuses on a number of topics including drawing and coloring, transformations, type, tools, pathfinders and effects, the document environment, and printing. The test taker will also be evaluated on the use of effective methods in the creation of vector graphics as well as the understanding of the software environment.

Additional Adobe CS5 assessments are available.

tests.title: Adobe Illustrator CS6
tests.description:
The Adobe Illustrator CS6 test is designed to assess a test taker's ability to understand and use Illustrator. The test taker will also be evaluated on the use of tools and coloring as well as the understanding of the software environment. The assessment focuses on a number of topics including Illustrator tools, working with colors, and Illustrator features and functions, and printing. This test is appropriate to administer to test takers with a year or more experience working with Adobe Illustrator CS6.

Additional Adobe CS6 assessments are available.

tests.title: Adobe InDesign - Creative Cloud
tests.description:
This Adobe InDesign - Creative Cloud test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of InDesign, terminology specific to layouts and publishing, and features specific to Creative Cloud. Other topics on this assessment include document setup, deliverables, design tools and working with video. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe InDesign - Creative Cloud.

Assessments for the Creative Cloud versions of Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Dreamweaver and Adobe Photoshop are also available.

tests.title: Adobe InDesign CS
tests.description:
The test for Adobe InDesign CS is a broad general test for people with about one year's experience through expert users. The test would be appropriate for business owners who are screening potential employees for their skill level, or for schools who need to know a student's proficiency for placement in classes. There are five types of questions: Pages, Typography, Graphics, Typography with Graphics, and Output.

Assessments for Adobe Photoshop CS and Adobe Illustrator CS are also available.

tests.title: Adobe InDesign CS2
tests.description:
Adobe InDesign CS2 is the layout and desktop publishing arm within the Adobe Creative Suite. This assessment will determine a test taker's level of knowledge using InDesign CS2 for basic functions such as creating a new document to more advanced functions. Topics include Layout, Typography, Preparation for Printer, Interactive, and Objects. Most of the questions are based on scenarios encountered as a Production Artist or Graphic Designer. While a Mac was used to generate the images, the assessment is applicable for both Mac and PC users.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator CS and Adobe PhotoShop CS2 are also available.

tests.title: Adobe InDesign CS3
tests.description:
Adobe InDesign CS3 is the layout and desktop publishing arm within the Adobe Creative Suite. This questionnaire has been designed to test the general knowledge of the applicant and covers a wide variety of the applications uses, taking into account any upgraded or new features that have been made in this latest revision of the software. Questions have been created with a practical office setting in mind and this assessment is appropriate for beginning to intermediate users.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator CS2, Adobe PhotoShop CS2, and Adobe InDesign CS2 are also available.

tests.title: Adobe InDesign CS4
tests.description:
This Adobe InDesign CS4 test is designed to access a test taker's ability to properly produce projects and documents for Web or print design by utilizing this program. With this in mind, the assessment presents questions that focus on a variety of topics that include colors, fonts and styles, tables, images and shapes, interactivity, layers, and page sizing. This assessment is appropriate for beginner and intermediate Adobe InDesign CS4 users with a year or more experience.

Additional Adobe assessments are available.

tests.title: Adobe InDesign CS5
tests.description:
This Adobe InDesign CS5 test is designed to access a test taker's ability to properly produce projects and documents for Web or print design by utilizing this program. With this in mind, the assessment presents questions that focus on a variety of topics that include colors, fonts and styles, tables, images and shapes, interactivity, layers, and page sizing. This assessment is appropriate for beginner and intermediate Adobe InDesign CS5 users with a year or more experience.

Additional Adobe CS5 assessments are available.

tests.title: Adobe InDesign CS6
tests.description:
This Adobe InDesign CS6 test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of InDesign as well as terminology specific to the publishing field. Topics on this assessment include managing pages, text, graphics, objects, formatting, styles, tables, and tools. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe InDesign CS6.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop are also available.

tests.title: Adobe PageMaker 7
tests.description:
Adobe PageMaker 7 software is a page layout program for business, education, and small offices for creating high-quality publications such as brochures and newsletters. The test focuses on templates, graphics, and intuitive design tools; as well as work productively across Adobe applications; and easily leverage existing content to create customized communications. Topics include Constructing/Composition, Formatting, Objects, and Color Management.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator CS2 and Adobe Photoshop CS2 are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Photoshop - Creative Cloud
tests.description:
This Adobe Photoshop - Creative Cloud test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of Photoshop, producing and reusing images, terminology specific to digital image work, and features specific to Creative Cloud. Other topics on this assessment include meaning and terms, production tasks, tools and interface, and workflow efficiency. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe Photoshop - Creative Cloud.

Assessments for the Creative Cloud versions of Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Dreamweaver and Adobe InDesign are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Photoshop CS
tests.description:
The test for Adobe Photoshop CS is a broad general test for people with about one year's experience through expert users. The test would be appropriate for business owners who are screening potential employees for their skill level, or for schools who need to know a student's proficiency for placement in classes. There are four types of material covered: Tools, Transformations, Adjustments, and Color.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator CS and Adobe InDesign CS are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Photoshop CS2
tests.description:
The test for Adobe Photoshop CS2 is a broad general test for people with about one to two years of experience. The test would be appropriate for business owners who are screening potential employees for their skill level or for schools who need to know a student's proficiency for placement in classes. It tests users on their knowledge of using Adobe Bridge as well as working with layers, masks, selections, and tools. This assessment also deals with basic photo retouching work.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator CS2 and Adobe InDesign CS2 are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Photoshop CS3
tests.description: This Adobe Photoshop CS3 test is designed for users that work with Photoshop CS3 in a production environment. It address some of the changes that have been made between the CS2 and CS3 versions of Photoshop whilst also looking at important fundamental areas of knowledge require to fully utilize the software. Questions will be directed at the editing and manipulation of graphical content as well as addressing the user interface and tools therein.

tests.title: Adobe Photoshop CS4
tests.description: This Adobe Photoshop CS4 test is designed to access a test taker's ability to properly utilize the program. Being able to determine between specific effects, tools, and modes in Photoshop is vital for using the program properly. With this in mind, the assessment presents questions that focus on a variety of topics that include saving for Web and devices, working with layers, paths, selections, and types, resizing and cropping, photo editing, tools and adjustments, and file and color modes. This assessment is appropriate for beginner and intermediate Adobe Photoshop CS4 users with a year or more experience.

tests.title: Adobe Photoshop CS5
tests.description:
This Adobe Photoshop CS5 test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of Photoshop, producing and reusing images, terminology specific to digital image work, and features specific to CS5. Other topics on this assessment include cropping, transformations, type, blends, layers, styles, retouching images and photos, and digital image essentials. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe Photoshop CS5.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator and Adobe InDesign are also available.

tests.title: Adobe Photoshop CS6
tests.description:
This Adobe Photoshop CS6 test is designed to assess a test taker's basic knowledge and understanding of Photoshop, producing and reusing images, terminology specific to digital image work, and features specific to CS6. Other topics on this assessment include cropping and transformations, documents and navigation, selection and layers, tools and filters, layer effects and styles, and Adobe Bridge as it relates to Photoshop CS6. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Adobe Photoshop CS6.

Assessments for Adobe Illustrator and Adobe InDesign are also available.

tests.title: Corel WordPerfect X6
tests.description: This WordPerfect X6 test is designed to show how proficient the applicant's WordPerfect knowledge is and how it may used in a business setting. Topics on this test include WordPerfect features, tools, formatting, saving, prints, icons, and images. This test is appropriate for entry-level and beginner Corel WordPerfect X6 users.

tests.title: Desktop Publishing Theory Skills
tests.description:
The Desktop Publishing Theory test measures the knowledge of concepts related to the pre-production processes involved in printing. Such topical areas include preparing color art, color theory, and proofing, among others.

Tests for Adobe PageMaker 6.5 and Lotus Freelance Graphics Millennium are also available.

tests.title: FileMaker Pro 6
tests.description:
The FileMaker Pro 6 database software lets users store, retrieve, organize, and analyze all types of data from complex billing records to customer accounts to home-video collections. It allows users to manage vast quantities of information, as well as share this information with other applications both on the network and over the Internet.

The FileMaker Pro 6 test covers a comprehensive range of topics, designed to evaluate the test taker's familiarity with general program usage and interface controls; ability to create and manage fields, field interactions, styles and relationships; skills applicable to calculations and scripting functionality; understanding of web and network integration; as well as knowledge of database security features and limitations. This test is appropriate for people with prior knowledge of FileMaker Pro software (version 6 or lower), who are working in the field of database development, database design or database administration.

Tests for Adobe PageMaker 6.5 and Corel Quattro Pro 9.0 are also available.

tests.title: Legal MacPac 2000
tests.description:
Legal MacPac (LMP) is an add-on product which works in conjunction with native Microsoft Word to assist in the creation of legal documents. LMP uses Word's heading and styles features to assist in the creation of documents, automatic numbering schemes, and table of contents as well as other legal document elements.

This test was created to determine the skill level of the test-taker in utilizing and efficiently locating LMP templates, macros, and customization options to expedite the creation of legal documents. This assessment is based on MacPac 2000 for version 9.7.2, which enables MacPac to be compatible with Office 2007 as well as 2003, XP, 2000, and 97.

Assessments for Legal Typing and Legal Spelling are also available.

tests.title: Lotus Notes 4.5 for Users
tests.description:
Lotus Notes is one of a breed of software referred to as GroupWare. GroupWare is used to manage shared databases, such as policy manuals, training material and client data. GroupWare is also used to create bulletin boards and set up messaging. The Lotus Notes 4.5 test is designed to identify knowledge of the basic tools and functions common to many installations of Lotus Notes. As Lotus Notes is a highly customizable application, the test is tailored to the most common uses of the application. This test is not appropriate for developers or administrators. For developers, please see the related Lotus Notes 4.5 for Developers test.

Tests for Lotus Notes 4.5 for Developers and Lotus 1-2-3 Millennium are also available.

tests.title: Lotus Notes 5.0 for Users
tests.description:
Lotus Notes is one of a breed of software referred to as GroupWare. GroupWare is used to manage shared databases, such as policy manuals, training material and client data. GroupWare is also used to create bulletin boards and set up messaging. The Lotus Notes 5.0 test for users is designed to identify knowledge of the basic tools and functions common to many installations of Lotus Notes. As Lotus Notes is a highly customizable application, the test is tailored to the most common uses of the application. This test is not appropriate for developers or administrators.

Tests for Lotus Notes 1-2-3 Millennium and WordPro Millennium are also available.

tests.title: Lotus Notes 6.5 for Users
tests.description:
Lotus Notes is often referred to as GroupWare. GroupWare is used to manage shared databases, such as policy manuals, training material and client data. GroupWare is also used to create bulletin boards and set up messaging.

The Lotus Notes 6.5 for Users assessment topics include Client Configuration, Database Knowledge, E-Mail Knowledge, Product Knowledge, and Security. As Lotus Notes is a highly customizable application, the test is tailored to the most common uses of the application with a small focus towards Lotus Notes Administrators.

This test is not appropriate for developers.

Assessments for Lotus Notes Administration and Lotus Notes R5 are also available.

tests.title: Lotus Notes 8.5 for Users
tests.description: This Lotus Notes 8.5 for Users test is designed to assess the knowledge of test takers in using Lotus Notes. This exam contains questions specifically on Lotus Notes 8.5 as well as on Lotus Notes in general. The topics covered include workspaces, views, notes applications, contacts, mail, and the calendar. It is appropriate to administer this assessment to test takers who have over one year of experience with Lotus Notes 8.5.

tests.title: Microsoft Access 2007
tests.description: Microsoft Access 2007 is a popular database application. It is included in Microsoft Office 2007, which also includes Word, Excel and PowerPoint. This test is designed to test data entry clerks and entry-level Access users by assessing the user's ability to add and edit data and use basic Access forms and reports. This test is not appropriate for Access developers or users who will need to create complex functions in Access. Use a Technical test for Access Developers.

tests.title: Microsoft Access 2016 Tutorial
tests.description:
Microsoft Access 2016 is a popular database application. It is included in Microsoft Office 2016, which also includes Word, Excel and PowerPoint. This tutorial targets data entry clerks and entry-level Access users and is designed to improve the user's ability to add and edit data using basic Access forms and reports.

This tutorial is not appropriate for Access developers or users who will need to create complex functions in Access, though it will familiarize the user with basic to intermediate tasks and concepts.

tests.title: Microsoft Excel 2003 - Normal User
tests.description: The Microsoft Excel 2003 Normal User test is designed to test clerical level users of Excel who are required to edit, develop and create Excel Workbooks. This test assesses the user's ability to create and develop a basic Excel workbook, including the most commonly used commands for formatting cells, navigation through the application, using formulas and changing the overall appearance of the spreadsheet.

tests.title: Microsoft Excel 2003 - Power User
tests.description: The Microsoft Excel 2003 Power User test attempts to provide the basis for separating candidates who possess limited exposure to Microsoft Excel 2003 from those who are conversant with the full functionality of the software. The primary topics include advanced formatting and formula writing.

tests.title: Microsoft Excel 2003 - Whole Test
tests.description: Microsoft Excel 2003 is a popular spreadsheet application. It is included in Microsoft Office Package, which also includes Word and PowerPoint. The Microsoft Excel 2003 Whole Test combines both the Normal and Power User Test. The Microsoft Excel 2003 Normal User test is designed to test clerical level users of Excel who are required to edit, develop and create Excel Workbooks. This test assesses the user's ability to create and develop a basic Excel workbook, including the most commonly used commands for formatting cells, navigation through the application, using formulas and changing the overall appearance of the spreadsheet. The Microsoft Excel 2003 Power User test attempts to provide the basis for separating candidates who possess limited exposure to Microsoft Excel 2003 from those who are conversant with the full functionality of the software. The primary topics include advanced formatting and formula writing. This test is designed to test candidates who will be required to use some of the more advanced features of the program, while the bulk of their responsibilities fall within conducting more basic level activities.

tests.title: Microsoft Excel 2013 Tutorial
tests.description:
The Microsoft Excel 2013 tutorial aims to improve the skill level of the user in navigating Microsoft Excel 2013 as well as their ability to complete several commonly used tasks.

Microsoft Excel 2013 is a popular spreadsheet application. It is included in the Microsoft Office Package, which also includes Word and PowerPoint.

The first half of this tutorial is designed to test clerical level users of Excel who are required to edit, develop, and create Excel Workbooks. This section helps the user to create and develop a basic Excel workbook, including the most commonly used commands for formatting cells, navigation through the application, using formulas, and changing the overall appearance of the spreadsheet.

The second half of the tutorial provides examples intended to familiarize the user with the full functionality of the software. The primary topics include advanced formatting and formula writing. This assists users who will be required to use some of the more advanced features of the program, while the bulk of their responsibilities fall within conducting more basic level activities.

tests.title: Microsoft FrontPage 2003
tests.description:
The Microsoft FrontPage 2003 assessment is designed to evaluate general knowledge of developing a webpage through Microsoft FrontPage 2003. Topics include Hyperlinks, Views, Formatting, Images, Publishing, Creating Webpages, and Tables. This assessment includes a few questions with HTML, but is primarily focused on familiarity with the application.

In order to test for more advanced web programming skills, please consider administrating the applicable programming assessment.

Assessments for HTML 4.0, DHTML, JavaScript, Microsoft Visio 2002, and Microsoft Publisher 2002 are also available.

tests.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer 10.0
tests.description: Microsoft Internet Explorer is an Internet Browser. It is available over the Internet and is also bundled with Microsoft Windows. The test is designed to test general user skills for the Microsoft Internet Explorer 10.0 browser. This test covers basic functions such as navigating through web pages, saving and loading information, using favorites, and changing settings. This test is appropriate to administer to those who need to use Internet Explorer to browse the Internet.

tests.title: Microsoft Outlook 2007
tests.description: Microsoft Outlook 2007 is a comprehensive personal information application, which combines Internet/Interoffice e-mail, a calendar and task list, address book and contact information, and notes and journals. Outlook is used to handle communication as well as organize information for individuals. It is part of Microsoft Office 2007. This test is designed for anyone who uses Outlook for their e-mail communication. This test assesses the user's ability to use common functions such as sending email and adding contacts as well as more advanced functions including arranging meetings and creating tasks. Topics include Application Features, Calendar, Contacts, E-mail, Notes and Tasks.

tests.title: Microsoft PowerPoint 2016 Tutorial
tests.description:
Microsoft PowerPoint is the most widely used application for creating slide presentations with graphics, charts, colors, shapes, and movement of the slides created. It is included in the Microsoft Office Suite, which also includes Word, Excel, Microsoft Publisher, and Access.

The PowerPoint 2016 tutorial is designed to teach the user each step in creating an exciting, unique, and personalized slide presentation that can be shown on the computer screen, or printed to transparencies and shown using a slide projector. The tutorial includes basic, intermediate and advanced tasks to show the user how to master and understand creating a dynamic presentation that can be used alone or combined with other selling tools in the business world.

tests.title: Microsoft Project 2000
tests.description:
This test focuses on Project 2000, developed by Microsoft Corporation. Microsoft Project 2000 is a robust application that provides solutions for total Project Management needs. Project 2000 enables resource scheduling, cost tracking, task analysis, project flow, standard reports, and customization features that make this application a truly versatile application that meets the needs of a wide variety of business and individual requirements. The test is intended to challenge the user at every level and covers such tasks as setting default views, changing the timescale, milestone markers, interim baselines, and resource flagging. This assessment would be appropriate to be given to anyone who needs to be a proficient user of Microsoft Project 2000.

Tests for Microsoft PowerPoint 2000, Microsoft Excel 2000, Microsoft Outlook 2000 and Microsoft Access are also available.

tests.title: Microsoft Project 2003
tests.description:
Microsoft Project is a project management program used to administer, track and analyze the key components of a project. The Microsoft Project 2003 assessment measures users' knowledge about the concepts and methods practiced in Project Management. Scoring well in the Basic questions should indicate that the user has basic knowledge of the features, while Intermediate to Advanced indicate higher knowledge and experience with the features of Microsoft Project. This test is written for those that have functional experience with Microsoft Project 2003.

Assessments for Microsoft Project 2002 and Project Management Fundamentals are also available.

tests.title: Microsoft Project 2007
tests.description: Microsoft Project 2007 is a software product utilized by project management professionals and management to gain an understanding of budget management, capacity planning, resource management, and project scheduling. This Microsoft Project 2007 test is designed to assess the knowledge of those who build, maintain, and control project plans in Microsoft Project 2007. The topics covered include task management, resource management, reporting, collaboration, and general knowledge. It is appropriate to administer this assessment to Microsoft Project 2007 users who have a year or more of experience.

tests.title: Microsoft Project 2010 Professional
tests.description: Microsoft Project 2010 is a software product utilized by project management professionals and management to manage budget management, capacity planning, resource management, and project scheduling. This Microsoft Project 2010 Professional test is designed to assess the knowledge of test takers concerning the use of Microsoft Project. The topics covered include navigation, tasks, resources, views, reports, and the trust center. It is appropriate to administer this assessment to users of Microsoft Project 2010 Professional with a year or more experience.

tests.title: Microsoft Project 2013
tests.description: Microsoft Project 2013 is a software product utilized by project management professionals and management to manage budget management, capacity planning, resource management, and project scheduling. This Microsoft Project 2013 Professional test is designed to assess the knowledge of test takers concerning the use of Microsoft Project. The topics covered include WBS, Project 2013 features, timeline, views and graphs, tasks, and resources. It is appropriate to administer this assessment to users of Microsoft Project 2013 with a year or more experience.

tests.title: Microsoft Publisher 2002
tests.description:
The Microsoft Publisher 2002 test aims at assessing the test taker's familiarity and functionality with Microsoft Publisher 2002. Topical areas include creating publications, using tools and menus, and special effect, among others.

Tests for Microsoft Word 2002 and Microsoft Access 2002 are also available.

tests.title: Microsoft Publisher 2007
tests.description:
This Microsoft Publisher 2007 assessment is used to measure a test taker's knowledge of the concepts and methods used in Publisher. Topics on creating, editing, and publishing a project are covered as well as some of the more advanced features. This test is written for those that have at least one year of hands-on experience with Microsoft Publisher 2007.

An assessment for Microsoft Publisher 2002 is also available.

tests.title: Microsoft Publisher 2010
tests.description: This Microsoft Publisher 2010 assessment is designed to assess a test-taker's knowledge of Publisher 2010 and its tools on creating and modifying text, objects, tables, and customizing the layout via the many design options. Topics covered by this assessment include design, publishing, the publisher interface, and troubleshooting. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Microsoft Publisher 2010.

tests.title: Microsoft Publisher 2013
tests.description: This Microsoft Publisher 2013 assessment is designed to assess a test-taker's knowledge of MS Publisher 2013 and its features used to create and modify text, objects, tables, and customized layouts. Topics covered by this assessment include tables, graphics, objects, mail merge, design, text, and program basics. This assessment is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Microsoft Publisher 2013.

tests.title: Microsoft Visio 2003
tests.description:
This test is used to determine a candidate's level of understanding Microsoft Visio 2003. This test aims at assessing the skill level of the user in the areas of diagrams, flowcharts, templates, shapes, advance features, and integration with other Microsoft Office applications. The questions are of real-world significance and are appropriate for someone who uses Visio 2003 on a regular basis.

Assessments for Adobe Photoshop, FileMaker Pro 6, and Microsoft Visio 2002 are also available.

tests.title: Microsoft Visual Studio 2015
tests.description: This Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 test is designed to assess the test taker's knowledge and familiarity with using Visual Studio 2015. The questions focus on several broad categories such as project templates, cross-platform support, configuring the IDE, framework, tools, views/windows, version control, testing etc. These questions are appropriate for Visual Studio 2015 users with at least one year of experience.

tests.title: Microsoft Windows 7
tests.description: Microsoft Windows is a popular operating system for desktop computers. This test is designed for clerical level users of Windows 7. It assesses the user's ability to perform common functions, such as running applications and organizing files, as well as more advanced functions, including installing software, and adding hardware. This test is for users only. Technical support candidates should be given the Windows Troubleshooting or Technical level TechTests for the version needed.

It includes basic, intermediate and advanced tasks and strives towards mastery of the most commonly used commands. This tutorial also features some of the unique features of Windows 7.

tests.title: Microsoft Windows XP

Among the tasks included in the Microsoft Word 2016 - Normal User test are formatting a document, inserting pictures, creating tables, sorting data, and conducting mail merges. This Microsoft Word 2016 - Power User test attempts to provide the basis for separating candidates who possess limited exposure to Microsoft Word 2016 with those who are conversant with the full functionality of the software. Advanced formatting, Charts, Themes, Styles and Table of Contents are among some of the topics addressed in this examination. This test is designed to assess candidates who will be required to use some of the more advanced features of the program on a daily basis.

tests.title: Microsoft Word 2016 - Whole Test [Timed]
tests.description:
This assessment has a time limit of 75 minutes.

Tests for Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint are also available.

tests.title: Microsoft Word 2016 Tutorial
tests.description:
The Microsoft Word 2016 tutorial aims to improve the skill level of the user in navigating Microsoft Word 2016 as well as their ability to complete several commonly used tasks.

Among the tasks included in this tutorial are formatting a document, inserting pictures, creating tables, sorting data, and conducting mail merges.

The second half of the tutorial provides examples intended to familiarize the user with the full functionality of the software. Advanced formatting, Charts, Themes, Styles and Table of Contents are also addressed. The Microsoft Word 2016 tutorial is designed to prepare the user to utilize both basic and advanced features of the program on a daily basis.

tests.title: Peachtree 2007
tests.description:
This Peachtree 2007 assessment evaluates a user's knowledge on a range of topics with an emphasis on the understanding and operation of the software. Areas focused on include vendors, payroll, the general ledger, reports and forms, banking, financial statements, and accounts payable and receivable. This test is developed for Peachtree 2007 users with a minimum of one year's experience with the program.

An assessment for Peachtree 2003 is also available.

tests.title: QuarkXPress 5 Advanced
tests.description:
QuarkXPress, once primarily an application for simple desktop publishing and text-oriented document creation, has evolved with capabilities challenging the veteran typographer, graphic artist and web designer. This test qualifies the level of advanced proficiency the applicant has with the program to differentiate between those using QuarkXPress primarily for: Word processing (administrative assistant); creative layouts (corporate graphic artist); or highly technical design (art director or production artist of a service bureau or ad agency). The Advanced test escalates beyond the applicants' fundamental knowledge of the program to assess their expanded understanding of text styles and formats, web document creation, preprint or web preparation abilities, as well as their advanced print production and troubleshooting techniques.

This test is appropriate to administer to those who will be required to employ advanced level skills using QuarkXpress 5 on the job.

Tests for QuarkXPress 5 Basic and Desktop Publishing Theory Skills are also available.

tests.title: QuarkXPress 5 Basics
tests.description:
QuarkXPress, once primarily an application for simple desktop publishing and text-oriented document creation, has evolved with capabilities challenging the veteran typographer, graphic artist and web designer. This test qualifies the level of fundamental knowledge the applicant has with the program to differentiate between those using QuarkXPress primarily for Word processing (administrative assistant) or complex layouts (graphic designer). The assessment includes topical areas such as basic features and functions of the program, incorporating images, setting text styles, creating web documents, and collection for output.

An assessment for Adobe Pagemaker 6.5 is also available.

tests.title: QuarkXpress 6
tests.description:
The purpose of this test is to gauge the level of knowledge of QuarkXPress 6.0. This test contains a mixture of questions that cover topics involving the use of QuarkXPress for word processing, creative layouts, and technical design. Areas that are touched on include the creation of text documents, the setting of text styles and formats, the creation of layouts for the web, the proper preprint or web preparation techniques, and advanced print production and troubleshooting techniques. The questions asked provide an insight on how much the applicant knows about QuarkXPress and features that are specific to QuarkXPress 6.0.

Assessments for QuarkXPress 5 Basics and QuarkXPress 5 Advanced are also available.

tests.title: QuarkXPress 9
tests.description: This QuarkXPress 9 assessment focuses on the use of QuarkXPress for graphic design with an emphasis on digital design for eBook Readers and iOS devices. Topics include QuarkXPress 9 design tools, digital and print design, troubleshooting, apps, and features. The questions asked provide an insight on how much the applicant knows about QuarkXPress as well as elements that are specific to QuarkXPress 9. This test is appropriate for QuarkXPress 9 users that have a year or more experience.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2006
tests.description:
QuickBooks Pro 2006 is accounting software used by businesses and companies to keep track of their finances. This test is designed to cover basic bookkeeping functions for users of the QuickBooks Pro 2006 software. Skills such as paying bills, creating checks, knowing what feature to use in a situation, generating reports, and setting up accounts are evaluated.

Tests for Bookkeeping, Accounts Payable, and Accounts Receivable are also available.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2007
tests.description:
QuickBooks Pro 2007 is accounting software used by businesses and companies to keep track of their finances. This test is designed to assess all skill levels for QuickBooks Pro 2007 users. Topics include accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll, invoicing, purchasing, and more. The results of this test will identify the level of comprehension in essential accounting principles and a candidate's full understanding of how to operate within this software.

Assessments for Bookkeeping, QuickBooks Pro 2006, Accounts Payable, and Accounts Receivable are also available.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2008
tests.description:
This QuickBooks Pro 2008 assessment is meant to test the skill and aptitude of accounting assistants, financial assistants, accounting clerks, and other QuickBooks users. It focuses on the general understanding needed to properly function within the QuickBooks Pro 2008 application environment as well as some specific areas that pertain to more advanced users.

This test covers a broad range of categories, including Setting up a Company, Accounts Payable and Receivable, Items and Inventory, Purchase Orders, Utilizing the QuickBooks Report Center, File Back-up and Restoration, Working with QuickBooks Lists, Working with Bank Accounts, and a number of other topics. This assessment is appropriate for experienced QuickBooks Pro 2008 users that have used the software for over a year.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2009
tests.description: This QuickBooks Pro 2009 test is designed to assess all skill levels for QuickBooks Pro 2009 users. The results of this test will identify the level of comprehension of essential accounting principles and also identify a candidate's understanding of how to operate this software. Topics include using QuickBooks Pro 2009 for accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll, invoicing, purchasing, and more. This assessment is appropriate for candidates that have at least a year's experience with QuickBooks Pro 2009.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2010
tests.description:
This QuickBooks Pro 2010 assessment covers the knowledge a QuickBooks Pro 2010 user should possess for day-to-day use of the QuickBooks Pro accounting software. Test takers will be asked about how to use QuickBooks to perform specific tasks and the crediting and debiting of accounts along with a few general accounting questions. Topics include payroll, the general ledger, data entry, using the home page, reports, and proper procedures.

Assessments for Bookkeeping, Accounts Payable, and Accounts Receivable are also available.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2011
tests.description: This QuickBooks Pro 2011 test has been designed to measure the basic accounting and bookkeeping concepts involved with QuickBooks. This test will assess a test taker's ability to manage day-to-day business transactions using the functions available within QuickBooks Pro 2011. Topics covered by this test include QuickBooks features and procedures, general accounting principles, sales, company details, and accounts receivable and payable. This assessment is appropriate for Accounting Assistants, Financial Assistants and Accounting Clerks with at least a year or more of QuickBooks Pro 2011 experience.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2012
tests.description: This QuickBooks Pro 2012 test has been designed to measure the basic accounting and bookkeeping concepts involved with QuickBooks. Topics covered by this test include new QuickBooks features and procedures, payroll, the general ledger, vendors, information and transaction entry, company set up, the Lead Center, and reports. This assessment is appropriate for Accounting Assistants, Financial Assistants and Accounting Clerks with at least a year or more of QuickBooks Pro 2012 experience.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2013
tests.description: This QuickBooks Pro 2013 test has been designed to measure the basic accounting and bookkeeping concepts involved with QuickBooks. Topics covered by this test include new QuickBooks Pro 2013 features, information and transaction entry, reports and accounts, customers, and payroll. This assessment is appropriate for Accounting Assistants, Financial Assistants and Accounting Clerks with at least a year or more of QuickBooks Pro 2013 experience.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2013 v2
tests.description: This QuickBooks Pro 2013 test has been designed to measure the basic accounting and bookkeeping concepts involved with QuickBooks. This assessment is appropriate for Accounting Assistants, Financial Assistants and Accounting Clerks with at least a year or more of QuickBooks Pro 2013 experience.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2015
tests.description: This QuickBooks Pro 2015 test has been designed to measure the basic accounting and bookkeeping concepts involved with QuickBooks. Topics covered by this test include new QuickBooks Pro 2015 features, information and transaction entry, reports and accounts, and customers. This assessment is appropriate for Accounting Assistants, Financial Assistants and Accounting Clerks with at least a year or more of QuickBooks Pro 2015 experience.

tests.title: QuickBooks Pro 2017
tests.description: This QuickBooks Pro 2017 test has been designed to measure the basic accounting and bookkeeping concepts involved with QuickBooks. Topics covered by this test include new QuickBooks Pro 2017 features, daily data entry and accounting, banking and payroll, setup and customization, reporting and auditing, and year-end functions. This assessment is appropriate for Accounting Assistants, Financial Assistants and Accounting Clerks with at least a year or more of QuickBooks Pro 2017 experience.

tests.title: Quicken 2012
tests.description: This Quicken 2012 test has been designed to assess a test taker's knowledge and understanding of using the Quicken software. Topics covered by this test include account set up, data security, planning, bank, customer and vendor invoices, reports, and Quicken features. This assessment is appropriate for Quicken 2012 users with at least a year or more experience.

tests.title: Quicken 2013
tests.description: This Quicken 2013 test has been designed to assess a test taker's knowledge and understanding of the Quicken software. Topics covered by this test include billing and payments, accounts, categories and transactions, reports and graphs, and general Quicken knowledge. This assessment is appropriate to administer to Quicken 2013 users with at least a year or more experience.

tests.title: Sage Peachtree Pro 2012
tests.description: This Sage Peachtree Pro 2012 test measures the adequate knowledge and skills needed by the test taker to operate the Peachtree software efficiently. Topics covered on this test include accounts payable and receivable, banking, reports, setting up a company, chart of accounts, and performing tasks in Peachtree. This test is appropriate for test takers that have a year or more experience with Sage Peachtree Pro 2012.

tests.title: Sage Simply Accounting Pro 2012
tests.description: This Sage Simply Accounting Pro 2012 test has been drafted to evaluate a test-taker's level of familiarity with this accounting software. The topics covered on this assessment include accounts payable and receivable, accounting concepts, reports, data files and maintenance, and using Simply Accounting features. It is appropriate to administer this test to Simply Accounting Pro 2012 users with a year or more experience.

tests.title: Service-Oriented Architecture
tests.description: This Service-Oriented Architecture test has been designed to assess a test takers understanding of the business and technical aspects association with SOA implementation. Topics covered by this test include design and architecture, concepts, standards, and implementation. This assessment is appropriate for experienced developers that have worked with Service-Oriented Architecture.

tests.title: Simply Accounting 2006
tests.description:
The Simply Accounting 2006 assessment is designed to measure a user's knowledge of common features of the software. It will also measure the user's ability to update and maintain various bookkeeping tasks within a generic company that's already set up while challenging bookkeeping knowledge. (This test is country 'generic' - applicable to both the U.S. and Canada. Simply Accounting Release 13.0D was used in creating questions.)

Assessments for Bookkeeping and Accounting Terminology - Basic are also available.

tests.title: Simply Accounting 2010
tests.description:
The Simply Accounting 2010 assessment is designed to measure a user's knowledge of common features of the Simply Accounting software, basic bookkeeping tasks, and principles. Topics include accounts receivable, the general ledger, reports, Simply Accounting fundamentals, invoicing, and the information required to setup accounts.

Assessments for Bookkeeping and Accounting Terminology - Basic are also available.

tests.title: Summation iBlaze 3.0
tests.description: This Summation iBlaze 3.0 test is designed to assess the knowledge of test takers concerning the use of and concepts associated with the Summation iBlaze software. The topics covered include navigation, administration, data types, searches, transcripts and general Summation knowledge. It is appropriate to administer this assessment to test takers with a year or more experience working with Summation iBlaze.

tests.title: U.K. Lotus Notes 5.0 for Users
tests.description:
Lotus Notes is one of a breed of software referred to as GroupWare. GroupWare is used to manage shared databases, such as policy manuals, training material and client data. GroupWare is also used to create bulletin boards and set up messaging. The Lotus Notes 5.0 test for users is designed to identify knowledge of the basic tools and functions common to many installations of Lotus Notes. As Lotus Notes is a highly customisable application, the test is tailored to the most common uses of the application. This test is not appropriate for developers or administrators.

Tests for Lotus Notes 1-2-3 Millennium and WordPro Millennium are also available.
